medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms of proximal muscle weakness and dyspnea on exertion began five months prior to admission. One month later, she was admitted with worsening symptoms including rash and elevated creatine kinase. Despite initial treatment improvements, muscle weakness and dyspnea progressed, along with new symptoms such as increased fatigue, chills, night sweats, dysphagia, and productive cough occurring two days before current admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of glaucoma, hypothyroidism, and previous treatment for latent tuberculosis 10 years ago with isoniazid.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had myasthenia gravis; multiple family members had lung cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Worked as a health care provider, lived in New England, and had traveled to California but not outside the United States.
